citation.article-title: Isolation and comparative characteristics of methanogenic bacteria assimilating formate with the description of Methanobacterium thermoformicicum sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Methanobacterium thermoformicicum sp. nov.
Methanobacterium thermoformicicum (L. thermo, heat; L. formicicum, utilizing formate)
Morphology: slender, cylindrical, slightly curved rods, 0.3-0.5 by 2 μ or more.
Non-motile, nonsporing, with rounded ends, occurring singly or sometimes in chains of 2-cells.
They form aggregates of intertwined cells in the form of a "coarse cloth" in every medium on formate.
They multiply by dividing into two halves.
In an oxidized state, they exhibit inherent fluorescence in near UV.
They are not sensitive to penicillin.
Colonies are white with a dense center and filamentous margin.
Dependence on temperature: optimum 55°C; growth range 40-65°C.
Response to pH: optimum pH 7.0-8.0; growth range 6.0-8.7.
H2 + CO2 or formate serve as substrates for growth and methane production.
Nutrition: growth is autotrophic in a mineral medium with H2 + CO2.
Yeast extract or trypticase at a concentration of 500 mg/liter does not stimulate or inhibit growth.
Deposited in the Division of Lithotrophic Microorgani Institute of Microbiology, Academy of Sciences of the USSR.
